Introduction¶

The current version of the python-mps package provides two separate implementations of algorithms that work with matrix product states (MPS):

  • DMRG: On the one hand, it provides an MPS implementation of the DMRG algorithm used for finding groundstates of 1D interacting models.
  • TEBD: On the other hand, there is the option of using the TEBD algorithm for performing (imaginary) time evolution.

The latter algorithm currently has most option, such as conserved quantum numbers and being able to directly simulate the thermodynamic limit.

Matrix Product States¶

\[W^{3\beta}_{\delta_1 \rho_1 \sigma_2} \approx U^{3\beta}_{\delta_1 \rho_1}\]
